page.title: 03Crop Farming, Fearn.
page.content: The farming life in our area is arable-based,mostly barley,wheat and stock rearing.Most farms are around 300-400 acres in size with a whole range of associated buildings and machinery.Winter and spring barley occupy the biggest acreage.This is used for animal feed and malting.Wheat is not grown on such a scale, but what is produced is sent south for flour manufacture.Hay is extensively used for stock feeding in winter.Some grass is cut and used as silage.This is stored in long pits, packed in plastic bags or stored in a large silo.Field sizes are large to improve efficiency.This also means that large machines can be utilised.At harvest time, most farms use up to three combines to cut the crops.Crops tend to be dried on the farm.
